intro: Asemeia extraaxillaris, commonly known as the extraaxillary asemeia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
